intro: Galium obliquum, commonly known as bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant has slender, often prostrate stems that are hairy and bear small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences and are usually white or pale pink. Galium obliquum produces small, three-lobed berries that are dispersed by birds and other animals.
